intro: Dalechampia humilis, commonly known as the small dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
